frame.name: Sign
frame.definition:
<def-root>A phenomenon, the <fen>Indicator</fen>, exists as an indication of another phenomenon, the <fen>Indicated</fen>. The relationship is asymmetric: the <fen>Indicated</fen> is not necessarily a sign for the existence or presence of an <fen>Indicator</fen>. The <fen>Indicated</fen> can be a past, present, or future entity or eventuality. The relationship between <fen>Indicator</fen> and <fen>Indicated</fen> is not one of symbolization or iconicity. Rather the <fen>Indicator</fen> is an index of the <fen>Indicated</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Indicator">This</fex> is a <t>sign</t> <fex name="Indicated">of things to come</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Indicator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The phenomenon that signifies the <fen>Indicated</fen>.
<ex>He was unable to display any <t><fex name="Indicator">sign</fex></t> of pain.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Indicated
FE.definition:
<def-root>The phenomenon that is signified by the <fen>Indicator</fen>.
<ex>We now exhibt the same <t>symptoms</t> <fex name="Indicated">of the same disease</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reliability
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Reliability</fen> of the <fen>Indicator</fen> as a sign of the <fen>Indicated</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the <fen>Indicator</fen> not covered by a more specific FE.
</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE depicts how often the <fen>Indicated</fen> manifests itself.
<ex>A 24-hour Holter moniter should be considered only for patients with <fex name="F">daily</fex> <t>symptoms</t>.</ex></def-root>
